Package fr.ign.artiscales.pm.decomposition

Class OBBBlockDecomposition

java.lang.Object
fr.ign.artiscales.pm.decomposition.OBBBlockDecomposition
public class OBBBlockDecomposition
extends java.lang.Object
Oriented Bounding Box algorithm implementation with methods to generate road network

  • Method Details

    • splitParcels

      public static org.geotools.data.simple.SimpleFeatureCollection splitParcels​(org.opengis.feature.simple.SimpleFeature toSplit, double maximalArea, double maximalWidth, double harmonyCoeff, double noise, java.util.List<org.locationtech.jts.geom.LineString> extBlock, double streetWidth, boolean forceStreetAccess, int decompositionLevelWithoutStreet)
      Split the parcels into sub parcels. The parcel that are going to be cut must have a field matching the MarkParcelAttributeFromPosition.getMarkFieldName() field or "SPLIT" by default with the value of 1.

      Overload to split a single parcel.

      Parameters:
      toSplit - SimpleFeatureCollection of parcels
      maximalArea - Area of the parcel under which the parcel won't be anymore cut
      maximalWidth - Width of the parcel under which the parcel won't be anymore cut
      harmonyCoeff - intensity of the forcing of a parcel to be connected with a road
      extBlock - outside of the parcels (representing road or public space)
      streetWidth - With of the street composing the street network
      decompositionLevelWithoutStreet - Number of last iteration row for which no street network is generated
      forceStreetAccess - Is the polygon should be turned in order to assure the connection with the road ? Also regarding the harmony coeff. Most of cases, it's yes
      Returns:
      a collection of subdivised parcels

    • splitParcel

      public static org.geotools.data.simple.SimpleFeatureCollection splitParcel​(org.opengis.feature.simple.SimpleFeature featToSplit, org.geotools.data.simple.SimpleFeatureCollection roads, double maximalArea, double maximalWidth, double harmonyCoeff, double noise, java.util.List<org.locationtech.jts.geom.LineString> extBlock, double smallStreetWidth, int largeStreetLevel, double largeStreetWidth, boolean forceStreetAccess, int decompositionLevelWithoutStreet)
      Split the parcels into sub parcels. The parcel that are going to be cut must have a field matching the MarkParcelAttributeFromPosition.getMarkFieldName() field or "SPLIT" by default with the value of 1.

      Overload to split a single parcel.

      Parameters:
      featToSplit - parcel
      maximalArea - Area of the parcel under which the parcel won't be anymore cut
      maximalWidth - Width of the parcel under which the parcel won't be anymore cut
      harmonyCoeff - intensity of the forcing of a parcel to be connected with a road
      extBlock - outside of the parcels (representing road or public space)
      smallStreetWidth - With of the street composing the street network
      decompositionLevelWithoutStreet - Number of last iteration row for which no street network is generated
      forceStreetAccess - Is the polygon should be turned in order to assure the connection with the road ? Also regarding the harmony coeff. Most of cases, it's yes
      largeStreetLevel - Level of decomposition in which large streets are generated
      largeStreetWidth - Width of the large streets
      noise - irregularity into parcel shape
      roads - Road layer (can be null)
      Returns:
      a collection of subdivised parcels

    • splitParcels

      public static org.geotools.data.simple.SimpleFeatureCollection splitParcels​(org.geotools.data.simple.SimpleFeatureCollection toSplit, java.io.File roadFile, fr.ign.artiscales.tools.parameter.ProfileUrbanFabric profile, boolean forceStreetAccess) throws java.io.IOException
      Split the parcels into sub parcels. The parcel that are going to be cut must have a field matching the MarkParcelAttributeFromPosition.getMarkFieldName() field or "SPLIT" by default with the value of 1.
      Parameters:
      toSplit - SimpleFeatureCollection of parcels
      roadFile - road file layer (can be null)
      profile - chosen ProfileUrbanFabric
      forceStreetAccess - Is the polygon should be turned in order to assure the connection with the road ? Also regarding the harmony coeff. Most of cases, it's yes
      Returns:
      a collection of subdivised parcels
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - reading geo files

    • splitParcels

      public static org.geotools.data.simple.SimpleFeatureCollection splitParcels​(org.geotools.data.simple.SimpleFeatureCollection toSplit, org.geotools.data.simple.SimpleFeatureCollection roads, double maximalArea, double maximalWidth, double harmonyCoeff, double noise, java.util.List<org.locationtech.jts.geom.LineString> extBlock, double smallStreetWidth, int largeStreetLevel, double largeStreetWidth, boolean forceStreetAccess, int decompositionLevelWithoutStreet)
      Split the parcels into sub parcels. The parcel that are going to be cut must have a field matching the MarkParcelAttributeFromPosition.getMarkFieldName() field or "SPLIT" by default with the value of 1.
      Parameters:
      toSplit - SimpleFeatureCollection of parcels
      roads - Road layer (can be null)
      maximalArea - Area of the parcel under which the parcel won't be anymore cut
      maximalWidth - Width of the parcel under which the parcel won't be anymore cut
      harmonyCoeff - intensity of the forcing of a parcel to be connected with a road
      noise - irregularity into parcel shape
      extBlock - outside of the parcels (representing road or public space)
      smallStreetWidth - Width of the small streets
      largeStreetLevel - Level of decomposition in which large streets are generated
      largeStreetWidth - Width of the large streets
      forceStreetAccess - Is the polygon should be turned in order to assure the connection with the road ? Also regarding the harmony coeff. Most of cases, it's yes
      decompositionLevelWithoutStreet - Number of last iteration row for which no street network is generated
      Returns:
      a collection of subdivised parcels
